In the first pers. plur. we have the hortatory use of the mood, e. g. φεύγωμεν, let us fly, which is equivalent to an imperative. In Latin the usage with the first sing. is unknown, though it is possible that the passage of some forms of the subjunctive (like regam, oudtbm) to the future indic. may be due to this usage.
